titleStmt.title:
Letter, Garner, T. Sampford
in Tallapoosa, Ga. to Temple & Rogers in Knoxville, Tenn.,
1861 November 23

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, T. Sampford Garner in Tallapoosa, Ga. to Temple & Rogers in Knoxville, Tenn., 1861 November 23
bibl.note: In this letter, dated November 23, 1861, T. Sampford Garner in Tallapoosa, Ga. writes to Temple & Rogers in Knoxville, Tenn., inquiring after the current situation of Parson Brownlow. He writes of Brownlow: "many such men as he is has never marked the face of this globe."

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Politicians -- Tennessee, East -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: gents will you do me the kindness to inform me what has been done with Mr. Brownlow I fill a grate anxiety in hearing what has become of him for many such men as he is has never marked the face of this globe would to God that there was one thousand in Georgia that was as unyielding as he hoping that he may long survive this struggle and once more be the participant of a Renowned Republican Government one that suits "him." I Remain yours
